intro: Pfeifferago obcordata, commonly known as the obcordate pfeifferago, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
